content:
• Tuesday, September 6, 2011
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) officially confirms CEO Carol Bartz has been removed, and Tim Morse has been...

    Yahoo (YHOO) officially confirms CEO Carol Bartz has been removed, and Tim Morse has been appointed as interim CEO in her place. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 PM | 11 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) CEO Carol Bartz in a note to her troops: "To all, I am very sad to tell you that...

    Yahoo (YHOO) CEO Carol Bartz in a note to her troops: "To all, I am very sad to tell you that I’ve just been fired over the phone by Yahoo’s Chairman of the Board. It has been my pleasure to work with all of you and I wish you only the best going forward. - Carol   Sent from my iPad"
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo's (YHOO) CEO Carol Bartz has reportedly been fired by Yahoo's board, however the situation...

    Yahoo's (YHOO) CEO Carol Bartz has reportedly been fired by Yahoo's board, however the situation surrounding the departure is unclear. CFO Tim Morse has been named interim CEO in her place. Shares +6.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBY-OLD

    The Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) Q2 beats on EPS but misses on revenue estimates. Overall sales were...

    The Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD) Q2 beats on EPS but misses on revenue estimates. Overall sales were 32% higher Y/Y, due to stable demand for maintenance and repair services, but same-store sales dipped 2%. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • DRI

    Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) says its preliminary FQ1 estimates will be short of analyst...

    Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) says its preliminary FQ1 estimates will be short of analyst expectations due to the adverse impact of Hurricane Irene. It now expects to earn $0.78 per share, below consensus estimates of $0.88. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSKN

    Shares of MELA Sciences (MELA) are soaring post-session after receiving European CE Mark...

    Shares of MELA Sciences (MELA) are soaring post-session after receiving European CE Mark approval for MelaFind, its device for evaluating and detecting melanoma, allowing the company to market it to dermatologists across the EU. Shares +32% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • FRAN

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) FQ2 profit dips 6.4% as a debt-related charge and higher...

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) FQ2 profit dips 6.4% as a debt-related charge and higher costs due to new boutique openings overshadowed growth in same-store sales. Share -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is up 7% AH after the company establishes FY13 (year begins on 1/30/12)...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is up 7% AH after the company establishes FY13 (year begins on 1/30/12) revenue guidance of $4.7B-$5B, above a $4.45B consensus, along with gross margin guidance of 51-53% Nvidia expects both its graphics and mobile processor businesses to drive growth. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • PAY

    More on VeriFone's (NYSE:PAY) FQ3 report: Acquisitions are "driving significant operating...

    More on VeriFone's (NYSE:PAY) FQ3 report: Acquisitions are "driving significant operating synergies and gross margin expansion through the elimination of overlapping expenses and through business process re-engineering." Expects Q4 net revenue of $395M-$400M and EPS in a range of $0.49-$0.50 in-line with analyst estimates. Shares +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • INTC

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) is down 3.9% AH after the chipmaker warns Q3 sales growth will be in a...

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) is down 3.9% AH after the chipmaker warns Q3 sales growth will be in a range of -3% to +1%, compared with prior guidance for +2% to +6%. Altera blames weaker demand in several markets, including its key Telecom and Wireless vertical (outside of Asia). Archrival Xilinx's (NASDAQ:XLNX) shares are nearly unchanged AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 3 Comments
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $317M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $18M....

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $317M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $18M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (KLAC -1.5%) finishes lower today after RBC cut it to underperform on valuation,...

    KLA-Tencor (KLAC -1.5%) finishes lower today after RBC cut it to underperform on valuation, citing the company's weak performance relative to its sector peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.8%) is up today after results from Phase II studies of its...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +1.8%) is up today after results from Phase II studies of its VX-509 drug showed significantly reduced signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2.1%) gets a boost higher today after Jefferies initiates the stock with a...

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2.1%) gets a boost higher today after Jefferies initiates the stock with a buy on valuation, setting a price target of $65.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • PEP

    PepsiCo (PEP -1.8%) may be ready for some football after its 10-year extension of a marketing...

    PepsiCo (PEP -1.8%) may be ready for some football after its 10-year extension of a marketing partnership with the NFL, but Morgan Stanley worries that its sales are going flat, cutting its stock rating to Equal Weight from Overweight. Morgan Stanley also says PepsiCo's large exposure to the U.S. is unfavorable compared to other large food companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • VRSN

    Shares of VeriSign (VRSN +5.9%) soared late today on takeover gossip, but are now settling back...

    Shares of VeriSign (VRSN +5.9%) soared late today on takeover gossip, but are now settling back a bit after it looks like the rumor could be unfounded. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • HOLX

    Gen-Probe (GPRO +2.4%) gains on a valuation upgrade to speculative buy at Canaccord, citing its...

    Gen-Probe (GPRO +2.4%) gains on a valuation upgrade to speculative buy at Canaccord, citing its new product cycle and strong sector leadership position.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • WAIR

    Wesco Aircraft Holdings (WAIR +3.5%), takes off after being initiated by a number of Wall Street...

    Wesco Aircraft Holdings (WAIR +3.5%), takes off after being initiated by a number of Wall Street firms. Morgan Stanley, who starts it with an outperform, says it's the only pure-play in the sizable aerospace distribution market, and one of the few small-cap growth stories left in A&D.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • ULGX

    Urologix (ULGX +27%) soars MDT)">after announcing it's signed an exclusive worldwide license to...

    Urologix (ULGX +27%) soars after announcing it's signed an exclusive worldwide license to manufacture and market Medtronic's (MDT +0.2%) Prostiva RF Therapy System for the treatment of BPH.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • SQBG

    Martha Stewart Living (MSO -4.3%) is lower today after saying it was replacing its CFO with...

    Martha Stewart Living (MSO -4.3%) is lower today after saying it was replacing its CFO with Marvel Entertainment's Ken West, and reshuffling its television business management team.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +2.2%) is trading higher after it signs a deal to acquire privately held...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +2.2%) is trading higher after it signs a deal to acquire privately held Canadian firm Quinn's Oilfield Supply for about $303M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • BAC

    KBW weighs in on the FHFA lawsuit filed Friday against the banks, saying it could cost the...

    KBW weighs in on the FHFA lawsuit filed Friday against the banks, saying it could cost the mortgage-bond issuers nearly $60B. A much smaller settlement is more likely however, because the banks have a strong defense. Bank of America (BAC -3.3%), Citigroup (C -2.5%) and J.P. Morgan Chase (JPM -3.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • HRBN

    Shares of Harbin Electric (HRBN -2.7%) and Deer Consumer Products (OTC:DEER -17.2%) move lower...

    Shares of Harbin Electric (HRBN -2.7%) and Deer Consumer Products (OTC:DEER -17.2%) move lower following Alfred Little's latest post that says Chinese government officials confirm "multi-million dollar land fraud" at the two firms. Shares of HRBN were higher earlier after the CEO reaffirmed the "going private" offer at $24/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (PRGS -6.8%) cuts FQ3 guidance due to lower-than-expected revenue from its...

    Progress Software (PRGS -6.8%) cuts FQ3 guidance due to lower-than-expected revenue from its enterprise business solutions unit, and higher employee-separation costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • VHI

    Shares of Valhi (VHI +0.9%) manage to post a small gain on a day decliners are beating advancers...

    Shares of Valhi (VHI +0.9%) manage to post a small gain on a day decliners are beating advancers by more than a 6-to-1 ratio. SEC filings show the company's chairman is helping the cause by adding more shares, even with the agricultural firm's stock on a runup of 44% over the last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN -3.5%) is down today after announcing its CFO John F. Tierney is stepping down....

    DineEquity (DIN -3.5%) is down today after announcing its CFO John F. Tierney is stepping down. He will be succeeded by Tom Emrey, COO of Universal Studios Home Entertainment, beginning next week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ZION

    Zions Bancorp (ZION -2.3%) is lower this morning on a Nomura downgrade. The firm says the bank...

    Zions Bancorp (ZION -2.3%) is lower this morning on a Nomura downgrade. The firm says the bank is poorly positioned to benefit from the increase in mortgage-refinances expected in the second half of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • BAYRY

    German drug maker Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY -12%) takes a hit this morning after Xarelto, the drug it's...

    German drug maker Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY -12%) takes a hit this morning after Xarelto, the drug it's co-developing with Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -0.5%) was rejected by FDA scientists.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • SODA

    SodaStream International (SODA +3.5%) is higher this morning after JP Morgan ups the shares on...

    SodaStream International (SODA +3.5%) is higher this morning after JP Morgan ups the shares on valuation, citing the company's near-term growth potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • TAOM

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (NYSE:TAOM), which went public in June, is up 4.3% after...

    Chinese children's media site Taomee (NYSE:TAOM), which went public in June, is up 4.3% after announcing Chairman Jason Liqing Zeng has purchased 216K shares of the company's stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • HOLI

    Hollysys (NASDAQ:HOLI), a Chinese maker of industrial automation and control systems, is up...

    Hollysys (NASDAQ:HOLI), a Chinese maker of industrial automation and control systems, is up 12.7% after announcing several members of its management, including its Chairman and CEO, have jointly purchased 725,467 of the company's shares. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin (LMT -1.3%) moves off its lows after announcing its been awarded a $100.5M...

    Lockheed Martin (LMT -1.3%) moves off its lows after announcing its been awarded a $100.5M contract from the U.S. Air Force for production of Paveway II Plus laser bomb guidance kits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • TZOO

    Wedbush slashes its price target on shares of Travelzoo (TZOO -4.8%) to $72 from $107 on...

    Wedbush slashes its price target on shares of Travelzoo (TZOO -4.8%) to $72 from $107 on concerns over increased competition and declining sales. The new PT still marks a premium pgf 125% over TZOO's current trading price after a month-long downward slide saw the stock lose 33%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR -6.5%) takes a hit this morning after Goldman cuts the shares to neutral, saying...

    Whirlpool (WHR -6.5%) takes a hit this morning after Goldman cuts the shares to neutral, saying sharp earnings deceleration through 2013 will weigh on multiple expansion and Street estimates are vulnerable.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM

  • The CBOE Volatility Index tacks on a 16% gain after investors decide to head to safer waters....

    The CBOE Volatility Index tacks on a 16% gain after investors decide to head to safer waters. Digging into trading on VIX futures trading, Schaeffer's Investment Research's Adam Warner finds the market is pricing in high volatility and big market moves for several more months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • BTH

    Blyth (BTH +13%) bucks a weak tape this morning after raising its FY12 guidance on significant...

    Blyth (BTH +13%) bucks a weak tape this morning after raising its FY12 guidance on significant sales and distributor growth in its network marketing unit ViSalus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • NKE

    HSBC downgrades Nike (NKE -3.2%) to Neutral from Overweight with a $96 PT. The firm notes...

    HSBC downgrades Nike (NKE -3.2%) to Neutral from Overweight with a $96 PT. The firm notes potentially weak back-to-school consumer spending and a concern if Nike has lost its competitive position in Europe and Russia against rival Adidas (OTCQX:ADDYY) leading up to the Euro soccer championship next summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • SHAW

    Shaw Group (NYSE:SHAW) says one of its subsidiaries will exercise put options to sell a 20%...

    Shaw Group (NYSE:SHAW) says one of its subsidiaries will exercise put options to sell a 20% stake in Westinghouse back to Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF). The firm's CEO says the move will help eliminate $1.7B of debt. Shares moved 6.9% higher following the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -0.4%) is outperforming the market after 9to5 Mac reports the video game retailer...

    GameStop (GME -0.4%) is outperforming the market after 9to5 Mac reports the video game retailer will soon begin selling Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) entire iOS product line. The deal could provide a sales boost to GameStop, which has struggled this year to cope with soft U.S. video game demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCGLY

    The big banks being sued by the FHFA are taking a beating, exacerbated by the aggressive selling...

    The big banks being sued by the FHFA are taking a beating, exacerbated by the aggressive selling in European banks: OTCPK:SCGLY -13.9%, CS -12.1%, RBS -12.1%, DB -8.9, BCS -8.9%, NMR -7.6%, BAC -6%, C -5.1%, JPM -4.5%, HBC -4.5%, GE -4.4%, MS -4.3%, FHN -3.6%, GS -2.8%. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • AN

    AutoNation's (AN -3.8%) weak August sales report looks like it hit a raw nerve with investors...

    AutoNation's (AN -3.8%) weak August sales report looks like it hit a raw nerve with investors already nervous about companies depending on the auto industry. Prominent decliners: Goodyear (GT -6.4%), Bridgestone (OTCPK:BRDCY -5.7%), Autolive (ALV -3.9%), KAR Auction Services (KAR -3.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • ATGE

    DeVry (DV +1.4%) posts a tidy gain after seeing Deutsche upgrade the online college degree...

    DeVry (DV +1.4%) posts a tidy gain after seeing Deutsche upgrade the online college degree company to Buy from Hold on a valuation call. Deutsche set a PT of $53 on shares, a 28% premium to its current price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • HOG

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (HOG -6.6%) take a beating after UBS clips its price target to $39,...

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (HOG -6.6%) take a beating after UBS clips its price target to $39, noting Harley faces tough August sales comparables in a weak U.S. economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -3.9%) shares slide after Piper Jaffray cuts its rating to Neutral and lowers its...

    Best Buy (BBY -3.9%) shares slide after Piper Jaffray cuts its rating to Neutral and lowers its price target to $26 from $39. Valuation is intriguing, Jaffray says, but shares will remain weak due to its positioning in consumer electronics industry product cycles: 40% of sales are in flat-to-declining TVs and PCs, with a much lower share in tablets and mobile phones.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • ON

    As Fairchild (FCS) falls 3% after warning about its Q3 results, Lazard's Daniel Amir is raising...

    As Fairchild (FCS) falls 3% after warning about its Q3 results, Lazard's Daniel Amir is raising alarm bells about Broadcom (BRCM -4.5%). While reiterating a Buy, Amir notes his channel checks suggest Broadcom has instituted a hiring freeze, and he believes the company's current quarter "will be very back-end loaded."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • BAC

    History is repeating itself with Warren Buffett's rescues: BofA (NYSE:BAC) opens -5.2% at $6.87,...

    History is repeating itself with Warren Buffett's rescues: BofA (NYSE:BAC) opens -5.2% at $6.87, or $0.11 below its value before Buffett injected $5B. BofA had surged to $8.80 the day afterwards. The same happened with his investments in GS and GE, although he still made money on them.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • DNKN

    Goldman Sachs tags Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) with a Sell rating and a PT of $23, despite...

    Goldman Sachs tags Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) with a Sell rating and a PT of $23, despite calling the firm's margins the "best in class." The 65% runup of DNKN shares since its IPO has outpaced its fair valuation, according to Goldman. Shares down 5.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • GILD

    Premarket gainers: OTCPK:VRUS +9%. TLK +3%.Losers: CS -14%. RBS -13%. UBS -12%. ING -11%. ALU...

    Premarket gainers: OTCPK:VRUS +9%. TLK +3%.
    Losers: CS -14%. RBS -13%. UBS -12%. ING -11%. ALU -11%. STM -11%. IRE -10%. NBG -10%. DB -10%. CTIC -10%. LOGI -10%. ABB -9%. BCS -8%. MT -9%. LYG -9%. STD -8%. TS -7%. DNDN -6%. TEF -6%. ASML -6%. TOT -6%. FTE -6%. WFT -5%. RDS -5%. TSEM -5%. MPEL -5%. RIG -5%. NVS -5%. NOK -5%. SID -5%. BAC -5%. LVLT -5%. C -4%. JDSU -4%. HBC -5%. BHP -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • Italian stocks, -2.8% are leading fresh declines in Europe (Stoxx 50 -1.4%). Shares in Italian...

    Italian stocks, -2.8% are leading fresh declines in Europe (Stoxx 50 -1.4%). Shares in Italian lender Unicredit, -5.8%, are again halted. Reuters reports Angela Merkel warning German lawmakers of a domino effect should Greece exit the euro.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • TEF

    Struggling to compete with cheaper rivals in its home market, Telefonica (NYSE:TEF) has unveiled...

    Struggling to compete with cheaper rivals in its home market, Telefonica (NYSE:TEF) has unveiled plans to fold its domestic unit into its European division and reshuffle senior management. The carrier also intends to group its online businesses into a new unit called Telefonica Digital. Shares -6.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • GILD

    Shares of Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) are up 4.1% premarket after the company announced positive...

    Shares of Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) are up 4.1% premarket after the company announced positive results from a detailed test of its HCV treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM

  • European shares turn lower following a reflexive bounce off yesterday's drubbing. Stoxx 50 -0.3%...

    European shares turn lower following a reflexive bounce off yesterday's drubbing. Stoxx 50 -0.3% after being +1.5% earlier. Germany flat. Italy -1.5%. Spain -0.9%. U.K. +0.6%. Cheered by its central bank committing to printing unlimited quantities of francs, Switzerland +3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM

  • Japan's Nikkei falls 2.2% to finish at a 2.5-year low of 8,590.57 after debt fears flayed EU...

    Japan's Nikkei falls 2.2% to finish at a 2.5-year low of 8,590.57 after debt fears flayed EU stocks yesterday and on concerns that Obama's jobs speech Thursday won't boost the U.S. economy. Still, many EU indexes are green today: Euro STOXX +0.85%, London +1.5%, Paris +0.4%, Frankfurt +0.8% and Madrid +0.2%. Milan -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU stock markets seem to have calmed down following yesterday's drubbing and edge higher in...

    EU stock markets seem to have calmed down following yesterday's drubbing and edge higher in early trading. Euro STOXX 50 +0.9%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.8% and Madrid +0.6%, although Milan is -0.5%. U.S. stock futures pare earlier losses, with S&P 500 -1.7%, Dow -1.5% and Nasdaq 100 -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 AM | 2 Comments

  • As night follows day, a renewal of gold's record-breaking run follows the renewal of the...

    As night follows day, a renewal of gold's record-breaking run follows the renewal of the eurozone debt crisis. Spot gold hits an all-time high of $1,919.49, while GCcv1, the most-active U.S. gold futures contract, reaches $1,923.1.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 AM
